intro: Euklisia hyacinthoides, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Euklisia hyacinthoides is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
